Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4

Username: Axiom Consulting and Project Management LLCAxiom Consulting and Project Management LLC
Post Content:
Axiom is growing! We're looking for talented individuals to join our incredible team. If you're interested in being part of a dynamic and innovative company, please review the job description below and send your resume to hiring@axiompmp.com.Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) 📍 Location: Georgia, Atlanta 📅 Job Type: Full-Time About the Role: Axiom is seeking a Construction Quality Assurance Manager (CQAM) for a major highway transportation infrastructure project in Georgia. The CQAM will act as the primary liaison between project stakeholders, ensuring compliance with GDOT regulations, industry standards, and contractual quality requirements. Key Responsibilities: ✅ Oversee ICQA services and ensure compliance with the Construction Quality Management Plan (CQMP). ✅ Act as the single point of contact within Axiom for all project quality-related communications. ✅ Develop, implement, and monitor quality policies, procedures, and inspection protocols. ✅ Coordinate with GDOT, the Developer, and QAM to ensure inspection and testing activities align with project requirements. ✅ Review and approve QA test results, inspection reports, and corrective action plans. ✅ Identify and mitigate risks related to nonconforming work and ensure proper corrective action implementation. ✅ Ensure proper documentation and record-keeping of all ICQA activities. ✅ Monitor project schedules and ensure appropriate ICQA staffing. ✅ Issue Stop Work Notices when necessary and manage Nonconformance Reports (NCRs). Qualifications & Experience: ✔️ Must be a Licensed Professional Engineer (PE) in Georgia. ✔️ Minimum 10 years of experience in highway transportation infrastructure construction (project manager, superintendent, or senior construction quality assurance/inspection role). ✔️ Experience managing quality assurance for highway transportation projects involving interchanges, roadways, and bridges.  Why Join Axiom? 🔹 Work on a high-profile infrastructure project with GDOT – Be part of a transformative highway transportation initiative that will have a lasting impact on Georgia’s infrastructure and communities. 🔹 Play a key leadership role in ensuring construction quality and compliance – Take ownership of quality assurance processes, drive excellence in construction practices, and ensure project success through rigorous compliance with industry standards and GDOT regulations. 🔹 Competitive compensation and benefits – Enjoy a rewarding career with a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment that recognizes and rewards your expertise. 🔎 Interested? Apply now by sending your resume to 📩 hiring@axiompmp.com and take the next step in your career with Axiom!

🚨 Automation Engineers Are Not Testers—And That’s a Problem 🚨I see it all the time: teams hiring “QA Automation Engineers” who don’t actually test anything. They write code. They build frameworks. They automate whatever test cases they’re handed.But here’s the problem—automation without real testing skills is just code that gives you a false sense of security.I’ve worked with engineers who could build a perfect framework from scratch but had no clue how to design a meaningful test. Worse, they didn’t even question the test cases they were automating. They just blindly followed whatever was written, without improving or expanding them.And the result?❌ A bloated test suite that’s expensive to maintain but adds little value.❌ Missed edge cases because “it wasn’t in the test case.”❌ Tests that pass even when something is obviously broken—because they weren’t designed to truly validate behavior.Good automation starts with good testing. That means:✅ Knowing what’s worth automating (and what isn’t).✅ Thinking like a tester first, not just a developer writing code.✅ Reviewing and improving test cases, not just following them blindly.If we forget the testing mindset, we’re just writing code that go through the motions without proving anything meaningful.So let me ask—are you automating tests, or just automating steps? Let’s debate. 👇

📢hashtag#hiring We are looking for a hashtag#Pharmacist to join our Bio-Prospera  Clinical  Research  Pvt  Ltd. team. 𝑷𝒐𝒔𝒊𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏: Pharmacist (Clinical Department). 𝑬𝒙𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆: 2 - 4 years. 𝑸𝒖𝒂𝒍𝒊𝒇𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏: B-Pharm/M-Pharm.𝑱𝒐𝒊𝒏𝒊𝒏𝒈: Immediate.𝑹𝒆𝒔𝒑𝒐𝒏𝒔𝒊𝒃𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒊𝒆𝒔: ✔ Obtaining ICF from volunteers during Registration and Screening. ✔ Assist the principal investigator in conduction of protocol meeting. ✔ Assist the physician/ Principal investigator/ Clinical investigator in presentation of informed consent form.✔ Distribution of ICF for volunteers and group counselling of subjects.✔ Maintain the Pharmacy related activity (e.g., IP received, acceptance, dispensing, dosing, reconciliation etc).✔ Conducting and monitoring dispensing and dosing activity.✔ Monitoring clinical activities like blood collection, sample processing, meals and restriction activities.✔ Preparation, reviewing and compilation of study documents (TMF, CRF, ICF etc.).✔ Recording the subject check in and check out details.✔ Preparation of labels for sample collection and sample storage.✔ Providing response to QA, sponsor, regulatory audit observations with CAPA.✔ Recording of Temperature and relative humidity of relative activity areas.✔ Coordinate with clinical vendor like canteens, pathology lab, hospital, ambulance services, insurance company for study intimation.𝑺𝒂𝒍𝒂𝒓𝒚: As per industry Norms.Interested candidate can share their CV at ✉ 𝒉𝒓@𝒃𝒑𝒄𝒍𝒊𝒏𝒊𝒄𝒂𝒍.𝒄𝒐𝒎.𝑪𝒐𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒄𝒕 𝒖𝒔:+91 9730151113𝑷𝒍𝒆𝒂𝒔𝒆 𝒇𝒊𝒍𝒍 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒈𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒏 𝒇𝒐𝒓𝒎:https://lnkd.in/dSxwTvde Bio-Prospera  Clinical  Research  Pvt  Ltd.🌐 www.bpclinical.com 📍Viraj Industrial Estate, Plot. Why Are Top Game Studios Embracing Outsourcing? Game studio outsourcing refers to delegating specific parts of game development to external teams or companies. These can include:2D/3D Art & DesignGame development (Unity, Unreal, etc.)Animation, VFXQA TestingSound & MusicGame portingThe gaming industry is growing rapidly, but development costs and production timelines are also increasing. To maintain high-quality standards while optimizing resources, even industry giants like Ubisoft, Riot Games, and CD Projekt Red rely on outsourcing as a key part of their development pipeline.🔹 Cost Efficiency & Resource OptimizationMaintaining a large in-house team is expensive, especially for AAA projects. Outsourcing reduces overhead costs related to salaries, office space, and software tools, allowing studios to focus their budget where it matters most.🔹 Faster Production CyclesBig studios must accelerate development without sacrificing quality. By partnering with outsourcing teams specializing in art, animation, VFX, and QA, they can focus on core gameplay and overall game design.🔹 Access to Global TalentInstead of being limited by local hiring, outsourcing enables access to top talent worldwide, bringing fresh perspectives and creativity into game development.🔹 Risk Reduction & Development FlexibilityHiring and training new staff for each project is costly and time-consuming. Outsourcing allows studios to scale their workforce up or down as needed, making them more adaptable to industry trends and market demands.At Golden Sea Studio, we provide comprehensive outsourcing solutions, helping game studios optimize resources while maintaining quality and speed.Is your studio ready to leverage outsourcing for growth?hashtag#gameoutsourcing hashtag#gamedevelopment hashtag#goldenseastudio

Siemens Digital Industries Software is hiring a Software QA Engineer to join our team in Cairo, Egypt.The Calibre xRC tool offers robust parasitic extraction, delivering highly accurate parasitic data for comprehensive post-layout analysis and simulation. This rule-based extraction tool processes a design layout using a two-dimensional representation of its physical shapes (e.g., GDSII). It identifies patterns within the layout that match predefined extraction models, performs calculations based on actual design dimensions, and generates an extracted netlist. This netlist includes both the design circuit and its extracted parasitic components.  The extracted netlist is then used by SPICE circuit simulators and static timing analysis (STA) tools to refine the design, ensuring optimal performance, and eliminating potential operational issues.  Responsibilities:  * Advocate for quality processes and procedures throughout the product lifecycle, including inspections, code reviews, and requirements analysis. * Establish quality expectations, develop a plan to measure them, and ensure successful execution. * Ensure schedule predictability and track progress against objectives. * Assess and verify product functionality, usability, reliability, and serviceability in real-world customer environments. * Collaborate with customers, marketing, and customer support teams to understand requirements and user expectations. * Document past verification and validation efforts for reproducibility. * Conduct product testing to identify defects, limitations, and potential failure points. * Work closely with global engineering and QA teams to ensure high-quality outcomes. * Review functional and design specifications, internal and external product documentation, and provide feedback to key stakeholders (e.g., KPD, third-party providers). * Coordinate with software development and release teams to ensure smooth and reliable software releases.  Qualifications:  * B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication, or Computer Engineering. * Strong understanding of programming concepts. * Solid knowledge of scripting languages. * Proficiency in IC physical design, layout, and verification tools, as well as IC manufacturing processes. * Familiarity with Software Quality Assurance processes and software testing concepts (a plus). * Experience working with Linux/Unix operating systems. * Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate with Marketing (MKT) and R&D teams to understand software features and customer requirements. * Self-motivated with a strong aptitude for continuous learning.You can apply through: https://myjob.io/BhPdGW4
